result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard J Zywicki was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.

*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription and only if it is legal within the state he resides.
*Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
*Court leaves the alcohol prohibition to the discretion of the Department of Corrections and the defendant's doctor.

*Submit DNA sample, if not already done so
*Complete a parenting class
*Any other counseling or assessments as deeded appropriate by the Department of Corrections
*Complete 60 hours of community service

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard J Zywicki in court.  
1:26 p.m.  Court calls the case. 
Court reviews the file. 

Court notes the letter writer is not a party to this action.  Advises the defendant to file a motion to return the property.  Once filed, the motion hearing will be set and the DA needs to be notified. 
Court questions the defendant. 
Defendant responds. 
Court questions Atty Sheets who is present in the Courtroom. 
Atty Sheets states facts to the Court. 

Formal motion and date will need to be set.  No action will be taken today.
letter from H Dugenske dated 01/03/17 in re:  return of property
Review hearing on January 31, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Richard J Zywicki in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:07 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Sheets makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Sentence Withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months: 
Perform 60 hours community service. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription and only if it's legal within the state he resides. 
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Court leaves alcohol prohibition to the discretion of the Department of Corrections and the defendant's Doctor.   
Parenting Class. 
Any other counseling or assessments deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections. 

Court advises 20 days to appeal. 

Atty Molepske makes statements re: no credit. 
Atty Sheets concurs.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 6, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant Record Update
Status conference on November 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.

This is preliminary hearing.
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Based on the written waive and the defendant's responses and representation of counsel, Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently and understandingly waived the Preliminary Hearing.
Based on the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
